page.title: 17Wildlife - Animals-Mammals
page.content: Many different mammals are found in this area. Amongst the small mammals found are the hedgehog, the mole the common shrew, the pigmy shrew and the water shrew. Also common are voles, the bank vole, short-tailed vole and water vole or water rat. Mice are another common species in the area. The dormouse, harvest mouse, wood mouse, yellow-necked mouse and house mouse inhabit the local area. Larger mammals include rabbits, brown hares, badgers, foxes, weasels, stoats, polecats and otters. The only mammals able to fly, bats, live locally also. They include the Long-Eared Bat, the Horseshoe Bat, the Natterer's Bat, the Whiskered Bat, the Pipistrelle, the Noctule and the Daubenton's Bat.
